subject: Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Auburn Coach Tommy Tuberville reportedly agreed to a two-year contract extension yesterday that includes a $200,000 annual raise and ends speculation he might leave for another job.Tuberville told The Birmingham News and The Huntsville Times that he and Athletic Director Jay Jacobs reached an agreement that would run through the 2013 season. Tuberville, who had been mentioned as a candidate for the now-filled Texas A&M job and the Arkansas opening, will make $2.8 million next season, escalating to $3.8 million in the final year, the two newspapers reported.;Auburn Coach Tommy Tuberville reportedly agreed to a two-year contract extension yesterday that includes a $200,000 annual raise and ends speculation he might leave for another job.Tuberville told The Birmingham News and The Huntsville Times that he and Athletic Director Jay Jacobs reached an agreement that would run through the 2013 season. Tuberville, who had been mentioned as a candidate for the now-filled Texas A&M job and the Arkansas opening, will make $2.8 million next season, escalating to $3.8 million in the final year, the two newspapers reported.
